Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,138Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 64

Summary: Somewhere along the line, someone had told you that if you worked hard and honest, you could make a difference in people's lives. entry.title: Red Hood, Green Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Persadol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,847Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 54

Summary: Jason Todd has died before-and he hasn't quite come back whole. Haunted by shadows of his past and the weight of justice in Gotham, he finds comfort only in silence and the static crackle of Alfred's voice in his comms.That is, until the night a portal rips open above him and a very unexpected visitor-blue-skinned, horned, and definitely not from this world-crashes straight into his life. Literally.You're a druid from the forests of the Forgotten Realms, on a peaceful path of healing and harmony‚Ä¶ until a bandit ambush and a wild spell gone wrong land you flat on top of a masked stranger in a dark, alien city.Jason doesn't do magic. You don't do guns. But somehow, between Gotham rooftops and druidic spells, trauma and trust, gunfire and green growth-you might just change each other's worlds.

entry.title: how much longer 'till i'm taller?
entry.summary:
Author: artemissrx6

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,296Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 27

Summary: "I'm going to hug you now. Feel free to deck me. Just maybe not in the face." Before he can process, you pull him up and grab his shoulders to yank him towards you. Your arms circle around him, hands gently rubbing between his shoulder blades, and he hiccups a sob. He breaks down, and you hold him through it with the patience of a saint, because there's no way you're anything but some sort of divine gift brought to torment him with kindness and warmth. Once his tears stop falling, the shakes subsiding, you pull away just a little bit, to wipe his face with the sleeve of your hoodie. You smile at him, and something finally gives. He doesn't feel alone anymore. He always felt like sharing his sorrow would break the other person, letting them see the darkness brewing in his soul and tainting them with it, but you look the same as always. A bit tired, but still you. And his anguish feels less, feels like you scooped it up and took some with you, content to carry it with him.
